'Isopropyl alcohol' is a common name for a chemical compound with the
molecular formula C 3H 8O. It is a colorless, flammable
chemical compound with a strong odor. It is the simplest example of a
''secondary alcohol'', where the alcohol carbon is attached to two other
carbons sometimes shown as (CH 3) 2CHOH. It is a
structural isomer of propanol.
